medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain, fevers, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain started in the epigastric region 3 nights ago, then intensified and extended to the right upper quadrant, radiating down the right flank. The patient experienced nausea, vomiting, and fevers. There was a decrease in bowel movements, with the last being a small loose stool last night. The patient stated he had never experienced pain like this before.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Depression, obesity (s/p roux-en-Y gastric bypass with 80 lb weight loss), prior narcotic abuse after back injury, low back pain.
